alert.note: Alert for Northern Lycoming; Sullivan; Tioga (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 5:36AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHERN LYCOMING...SOUTHERN TIOGA AND WESTERN SULLIVAN COUNTIES THROUGH 630 AM EDT... At 534 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking the leading edge of a cluster of strong thunderstorms, located along a line that extended from Canton to 14 miles south of Mansfield to 13 miles northwest of Williamsport. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wellsboro, Morris, Blossburg, Covington, Arnot, Leetonia, Kettle Creek Gorge, Ralston, Ogdensburg, Cedar Run, English Center, Muncy Valley, Trout Run, Lincoln Falls, Barbours, Shunk, Buttonwood, Liberty, Forksville and Eagles Mere. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Very heavy rainfall of over one inch in 20 to 30 minutes is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
